instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT: What is PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT? PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT is the voltage rail for the backlight of the LCD screen. .
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
And missing all pads to solder a new <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
Can this board works without <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>? What is its role?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
threads.message:
Connect pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R5403</RESISTOR> to pin 1 of <RESISTOR>R5413</RESISTOR>. This is cheating but I think it should pass ASD like that. <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> is the current sensor for the CPU rails. 
Not sure if this will work but run ASD after you did this.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
threads.message:
Problem is this board has no video now. Not lvds and not external monitor. USB mouse is active (light). So I dont know where to start.

What I checked is in LVDS connector I have <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW_F</SIGNAL> at 3.3V

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
threads.message:
If <SIGNAL>PP3V3_LCDVDD_SW_F</SIGNAL> is high there must be an image, check again. Use a flashlight to check.

What is voltage on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
threads.message:
You are right. It works with another screen. With his screen no video... meybe lcd cable
With another screen it has video but no backlight. I did a reflow to <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP> and now backlight is ok. Should I replace it or this is ok

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
threads.message: Up to you, but I would replace to be sure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
threads.message: Ok, now I need to replace the screen. It is true all screen <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> from 2008 to 2012 are the same?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> missing <CHIP>U5400</CHIP>
